title: PHPexit()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPexit()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Print a message and exit the current script:
<?php
$site = "https://www..com/";
fopen($site,"r")
or exit("Unable to connect to $site");
?>
Definition and Usage
The exit() function prints a message and terminates the current script.
Syntax
exit(
message
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
message
Required. A message or status number to print before terminating the script.
    A status number will not be written to the output, just used as the exit 
    status.
Technical Details
Return Value:
Nothing
PHP Version:
4+

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
$site = "https://www.w3schools.com/";
fopen($site,"r")
or exit("Unable to connect to $site");
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPexit()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPexit()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPexit()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
